name: Ending Violence Against Migrants
bossPosition: Chairman of the Board of directors
goal:
Ending Violence Against Migrants (EVAM) aims to reduce and eliminate violence against migrants. To achieve this goal, we use a two-approaches methodology: a project-based approach (by improving the well-being of migrants in concrete and immediate terms) and a comprehensive approach (by collecting data and building a database on violence against migrants and refugees).

This methodology is divided into 4 phases:
- the "assessment and documentation" phase, which consists of collecting data on violence in migration, setting up a database and disseminating this data in order to have the most complete mapping of this violence;
- the "specific actions and projects" phase, which consists of supporting various field partners in their assessment work and in their projects aimed at concretely reducing violence against migrants;
- the "cross-cutting national policies" phase, which consists of mobilizing relevant actors at the national level to effectively reduce all forms of violence against migrants;
- the "regulation" phase, which consists of advocacy, at the international level, for better protection of migrants.
interests: Borders and Security, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum
